title: Supreme Court Appears Likely to Back Structure of Puerto Rico Debt-Relief Board
text:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court on Tuesday appeared likely to uphold the special board that Congress created to resolve Puerto Rico’s debt crisis, despite claims from creditors that its members were wrongly appointed.

The dispute turns on whether the oversight board supervising Puerto Rico’s finances is best considered a federal agency whose members must be presidential nominees confirmed by the Senate, or an entity structured by Congress under its authority to administer the U.S. territories.
